rules: Rule1: If the mechanic uses a diagnostic tool, then the mechanic repairs the vehicle.
Rule2: Either the customer agrees to the estimate or the insurance approves the claim.
Rule3: If the insurance approves the claim, then whenever the inspection of the vehicle is complete, provided that parts are ordered for the vehicle, the vehicle is repaired.
Rule4: Assuming the workshop authorizes the repair work, then if the inspection of the vehicle is complete, given that parts are ordered for the vehicle, the vehicle is repaired.
Rule5: Provided that the manager reviews the work order, it follows that if the customer agrees to the estimate, then the workshop authorizes the repair work.
Rule6: The customer requests a rush job or the workshop is operational.
Rule7: If the workshop schedules a standard service, then a rush job is not requested by the customer.
Rule8: In the event that the customer selects a maintenance package, a rush job is not requested by the customer.
Rule9: Given that the workshop has tools available, it follows that either the workshop schedules a standard service or the customer selects a maintenance package.
Rule10: If the technician is assigned to the vehicle, then the workshop experiences equipment malfunction.
Rule11: Either the technician is assigned to the vehicle or the mechanic is available according to the schedule.
Rule12: Under the condition that the mechanic is available according to the schedule, the workshop has tools available.
Rule13: Whenever the vehicle is in the bay, the workshop is operational.
Rule14: If the service writer processes the vehicle, then given that the vehicle enters the workshop, the vehicle is in the bay.
Rule15: Either the service writer processes the vehicle or the receptionist directs the vehicle.
Rule16: Assuming the receptionist directs the vehicle, it follows that if the vehicle enters the workshop, then the vehicle is in the bay.
Rule17: Provided that the parts department confirms parts for the vehicle, then if the inspection of the vehicle is complete, given that parts are ordered for the vehicle, the vehicle is repaired.
Rule18: Either the parts department confirms parts for the vehicle or the supplier delivers parts.
Rule19: Under the condition that the workshop has parts ready, then whenever the inspection of the vehicle is complete, if parts are ordered for the vehicle, the vehicle is repaired.
Rule20: Provided that the parts manager coordinates the delivery, it follows that if the supplier delivers parts, then the workshop has parts ready.
Rule21: Either the parts manager coordinates the delivery or the expediter arranges the shipment.
Rule22: If the senior mechanic approves the repair plan, then provided that the mechanic repairs the vehicle, the workshop is operational.
Rule23: Either the senior mechanic approves the repair plan or the apprentice follows the repair manual.
Rule24: In the event that the workshop sources alternative parts, the delivery is not delayed.
Rule25: Either the workshop sources alternative parts or the customer accepts a backorder delay.

Rule26: Either the customer approves the estimate or, if the customer agrees to the estimate, then whenever the inspection of the vehicle is complete, given that parts are ordered for the vehicle, the vehicle is repaired.

Rule27: Provided that the accounting department processes payment for the invoice, it follows that if it is not the case that the budget being exceeded implies the customer does not approve the estimate, then the manager's approval is required for the overage.
Rule28: If the cashier collects payment, then the accounting department processes payment for the invoice.
Rule29: Either the cashier collects payment or the accounting department automates billing.

Rule30: Either the vehicle requires emergency repair or, if it is not the case that the workshop experiences equipment malfunction or the workshop has tools available, then the workshop operates under normal conditions.
Rule31: Provided that the vehicle enters the workshop, parts are ordered for the vehicle.
Rule32: If the vehicle is repaired, then the workshop is operational.
Rule33: If it is not the case that if the expediter arranges the shipment, then given that the supplier delivers parts, the workshop has parts ready, then the delivery is delayed.
Rule34: Provided that it is not the case that if the customer accepts a backorder delay, then the delivery is not delayed, the customer cancels the repair.

Rule35: Assuming it is not the case that if the accounting department automates billing, then the accounting department processes payment for the invoice, manual intervention is required in accounting.

Rule36: Provided that it is not the case that if the accounting department automates billing, then the accounting department processes payment for the invoice, manual intervention is not required in accounting.

Rule37: If it is not the case that if the apprentice follows the repair manual, then provided that the mechanic repairs the vehicle, the workshop is operational, the supervisor intervenes in the repair process.

Rule38: Under the condition that it is not the case that if the apprentice follows the repair manual, then provided that the mechanic repairs the vehicle, the workshop is operational, the supervisor does not intervene in the repair process.
facts: Fact1: The mechanic uses a diagnostic tool.
Fact2: The manager reviews the work order.
Fact4: The vehicle enters the workshop.
Fact5: Inspection of the vehicle is complete.
Fact6: The workshop does not experience equipment malfunction.
Fact7: The customer does not cancel the repair.
Fact8: The manager's approval is not required for the overage.
Fact9: The workshop does not operate under normal conditions.
Fact10: The vehicle does not require emergency repair.
